title: 112_hr2557
content: Establishment of a Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will establish the Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee to advise on interagency coordination, collaboration with other organizations, communication with constituency groups, representation of scientific viewpoints in public health policy decisions, and advising on priorities for Federal agencies. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will provide balanced information to the public and physicians, advise Federal agencies on priorities related to Lyme and tick-borne diseases, and consist of appointed members from various backgrounds including the scientific community, tick-borne disease organizations, and healthcare providers. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will include a diverse group of members, such as practicing physicians, patient representatives, and representatives from health departments and organizations. The Secretary will ensure that the members represent a variety of scientific perspectives. Additionally, there will be nonvoting ex officio members designated by the Secretary. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee will have nonvoting ex officio members from various Federal agencies designated by the Secretary. The Secretary will appoint the Assistant Secretary for Health as the co-chairperson and members will elect a public co-chairperson for a 2-year term. Each appointed member will serve a 4-year term. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee members serve 4-year terms, with vacancies filled in the same manner as original appointments. Meetings are held at least twice a year, with additional meetings as needed, and a report is due within 1 year of enactment. The Tick-Borne Diseases Advisory Committee is required to submit an annual report to the Secretary, detailing its functions, members, activities, and recommendations. An authorization of $250,000 for each fiscal year is allocated for the Committee's expenses under the Federal Advisory Committee Act. The Committee is authorized to receive funds for expenses and per diem costs under the Federal Advisory Committee Act, with the exception that voting members cannot be permanent salaried employees.
